@summaaftershow Exactly my point! In your analogy, the citizens should pay for the bullets. In this market, maybe ad rev or mag sales pay?
@Ecko1911 @GearboxSoftware That was a gift!  The best kind of surprise - no entitlement there, just being cool and thanks for showing up!
@will_tuttle @jeffgerstmann I like Jeff - one of the good ones.  You too, for that matter!
@JD_2020 Sadly the bad ones are actually the majority, but they're so irrelevant we hardly notice. Can't even field the 100's of requests...
@jeffgerstmann Legit small guys need to earn their credibility - just like you did.
@jfudge We normally do, but we're self publishing Homeworld.  Man, I love publishers when we're dealing with shit!
New proposal: Yes, you can have a free "review" copy of the game post-launch if you give equivalent value to a worthy charity.
@FuryAc3 I love this idea.
Credible critic? We're *grateful* for the attention! But these post-launch "can I get a freebie" e-mails we get by the 100's. Come on!?!
@jeffgerstmann Post launch, though? It's only $30! If a review isn't worth > $30, said critic should probably spend time elsewhere.
@jeffgerstmann I'm talking about post launch... Working pre-launch makes perfect sense. It's not about price, it's about access.
I mean, we're totally used to working with credible journalists pre-release for review copies. But after launch? It's only $30!
@Saieno Judging from what I'm seeing, I think this is the most accurate hypothesis.
@HM_Axyl Your hypothesis fails as the number of requests we gets tends to correlate directly to marketing dollars spent (awareness).
@GameOverGreggy Their salaries are driven by their value in the market, right? I didn't pick their careers for them...
Most journalists I interact with are super awesome, but some of these folks (who I've mostly never heard of) come off acting so entitled.
You'd think that if it was your JOB to be a critic of something, that you'd *want* to buy it yourself and be above and claim of favoritism.
Why do "journalists" come out of the woodwork asking for free copies of our games whenever we release a new one?
